snippet.textDisplay:
2 memories this evokes....

Playing as a kid, the first time I heard this, I just say on my turn menu listening to it. It was so good.

Years later in my 20's all wired up on Adderall, I randomly run into on youtube. Get stuck on it for like 6 hours+.

Great song!

Years later in my 20's all wired up on Adderall, I randomly run into on youtube. Get stuck on it for like 6 hours+.

Great song!

snippet.textDisplay:
Everything about this battle and the build-up was damn near perfect. The long-awaited revenge, the surge of emotion portrayed via the dialouge, the showdown between two vampires, the presence of this games Belmont, the moon rune betraying Neclord...
And all of it carried so well by the music! The battle was no pushover either, it took the knowledge of the entire Marely family, Sierra's control of the moon rune, and the combined effort of six badasses just to put up a fight!
snippet.textOriginal:
Everything about this battle and the build-up was damn near perfect. The long-awaited revenge, the surge of emotion portrayed via the dialouge, the showdown between two vampires, the presence of this games Belmont, the moon rune betraying Neclord...
And all of it carried so well by the music! The battle was no pushover either, it took the knowledge of the entire Marely family, Sierra's control of the moon rune, and the combined effort of six badasses just to put up a fight!

snippet.textDisplay:
@Namjala Latak,

Ah, what matters in this game is not so much the level but the group and how it is prepared.
In my opinion the Golem before the Neclord is more dangerous because it has very high attack and defense.

If you play this game with a person with Earth Rune and Riou (MC) retrieving MP and healing the group, all fights are easy, as there is no way to die like this.

Riou with recovery of MP in normal attack, healing and Nanami with Earth Rune increasing the defense.
With these two being used that way the rest of the group may be the worst characters in the game that is pretty easy. Just have good defense equipment and that's it.

edit:
I do this in every other Suikoden and it always works: someone with Earth Rune and another one recovering MP and healing.

edit 2:
If my memory does not fail me, the first time I played the game, Golem ended with me because I did not expect a fight like that. The same thing happened against Luca.
The game is only easy if you worry about finding ways to leave it easy or already have knowledge about it. If you play just to enjoy the game and doing the basics, at times it will be difficult.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Namjala Latak,

Ah, what matters in this game is not so much the level but the group and how it is prepared.
In my opinion the Golem before the Neclord is more dangerous because it has very high attack and defense.

If you play this game with a person with Earth Rune and Riou (MC) retrieving MP and healing the group, all fights are easy, as there is no way to die like this.

Riou with recovery of MP in normal attack, healing and Nanami with Earth Rune increasing the defense.
With these two being used that way the rest of the group may be the worst characters in the game that is pretty easy. Just have good defense equipment and that's it.

edit:
I do this in every other Suikoden and it always works: someone with Earth Rune and another one recovering MP and healing.

edit 2:
If my memory does not fail me, the first time I played the game, Golem ended with me because I did not expect a fight like that. The same thing happened against Luca.
The game is only easy if you worry about finding ways to leave it easy or already have knowledge about it. If you play just to enjoy the game and doing the basics, at times it will be difficult.

snippet.textDisplay:
@dhana piereza,
Almost every fight in this game ends quickly. That's exactly why I avoid getting extremely strong every time I play.
This game despite being wonderful is absurdly and extremely easy. It only threatens to pretend to have difficulty in Tinto, but it is nothing.

Fury + Double Beat is the most overpower thing that can exist in this game, as well as the spells.
When I play I only use Fury in Oulan and Double Beat with someone very weak. The spells avoid using lvl3 or higher
snippet.textOriginal:

When I play I only use Fury in Oulan and Double Beat with someone very weak. The spells avoid using lvl3 or higher

snippet.textDisplay: +David Captain Charisma Ryan Neclord was still sort of at his full strength when you face him in Suikoden 1. All you had was the Star Dragon Sword which was not...really effective against a vampire bearing the Moon Rune. You fight against Neclord, who just lost his main source of power to Sierra, had most of his remaining power sealed by Kahn, and with the Star Dragon Sword. Frankly the struggle he put up was quite remarkable considering how heavily he was handicapped against the hero's party in the second game.
snippet.textOriginal: +David Captain Charisma Ryan Neclord was still sort of at his full strength when you face him in Suikoden 1. All you had was the Star Dragon Sword which was not...really effective against a vampire bearing the Moon Rune. You fight against Neclord, who just lost his main source of power to Sierra, had most of his remaining power sealed by Kahn, and with the Star Dragon Sword. Frankly the struggle he put up was quite remarkable considering how heavily he was handicapped against the hero's party in the second game.

snippet.textDisplay:
@Domagoj Vuković If you take notice they actually do a pretty good job at balancing the characters in this series via STATS/EQUIP PROFICIENCIES/RUNE SLOTS/DEFAULTS/WEAPON POWER.

The best characters end up being the balanced & slightly faster (usually female) characters with 3 open rune slots though. They're able to do anything.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Domagoj Vuković If you take notice they actually do a pretty good job at balancing the characters in this series via STATS/EQUIP PROFICIENCIES/RUNE SLOTS/DEFAULTS/WEAPON POWER.

The best characters end up being the balanced & slightly faster (usually female) characters with 3 open rune slots though. They're able to do anything.

snippet.textDisplay:
Depends on how you define filler. Although this guy wasn't the final boss in both games he appeared he arguably was more evil/killed more peoples then the actual final bosses. He just was content with terrorizing small villages and having his castle. If this guy decided taking over the world was worth it he'd easily be the final boss. I mean seriously it took like some of the best SPECIALIZED fighters against him to take him down. As one guy said he was terribly weakened in Suikoden 2 too.

He had almost more influence on the good guys then the actual villains did too. You got like 4-5 characters whose main goal in life was to take this motherfucker down.

Still this guy had to compete with Luca Blight so yeah he's the best villain in Suikoden but Suikoden 2 had Mister DIE PIGS.
snippet.textOriginal:

I mean seriously it took like some of the best SPECIALIZED fighters against him to take him down. As one guy said he was terribly weakened in Suikoden 2 too.

He had almost more influence on the good guys then the actual villains did too. You got like 4-5 characters whose main goal in life was to take this motherfucker down.

Still this guy had to compete with Luca Blight so yeah he's the best villain in Suikoden but Suikoden 2 had Mister DIE PIGS.

snippet.textDisplay: well, technically, if you've played suikoden 1, neclord's body got very damaged from Victor and and the Star Dragon Sword. That's why in suikoden 2, he's not as powerful as in the first one, he was still recovering, in fact, if i'm not mistaken, the first time you run in to neclord in North Window City in Suikoden 2, he mentions his body is still in pain and recovering from that fight. If that helps explain at all why he was weak in this game as a boss fight.
snippet.textOriginal: well, technically, if you've played suikoden 1, neclord's body got very damaged from Victor and and the Star Dragon Sword. That's why in suikoden 2, he's not as powerful as in the first one, he was still recovering, in fact, if i'm not mistaken, the first time you run in to neclord in North Window City in Suikoden 2, he mentions his body is still in pain and recovering from that fight. If that helps explain at all why he was weak in this game as a boss fight.

snippet.textDisplay: It's been a few years so I may be remembering incorrectly, but if not lightning I would swear he was immune to most spells.  I unloaded my best ones on him and don't remember doing any real damage to him at all.  I need to dig up my game again...if nothing else this gives me an excuse to play it again :)

snippet.textDisplay:
He is actually very hard if you don't know his golem in the fight before him is immune to magic.  If you waste all your 1-shot only best runes on the golem Neclord is a much tougher fight.

Still, I do agree.  Neclord sorta got wimpified in this game.
snippet.textOriginal:
He is actually very hard if you don't know his golem in the fight before him is immune to magic.  If you waste all your 1-shot only best runes on the golem Neclord is a much tougher fight.

Still, I do agree.  Neclord sorta got wimpified in this game.

snippet.textDisplay:
Konami makes albums for all previous Suikoden titels constantly. (Such as celtic collections... or the last one "Rhapsodia - Privilege Music Collection" where you find titels from Suikoden II and also from Suikoden V. xD 
All Genso Suikoden Series Soundtracks are great!
snippet.textOriginal:
Konami makes albums for all previous Suikoden titels constantly. (Such as celtic collections... or the last one "Rhapsodia - Privilege Music Collection" where you find titels from Suikoden II and also from Suikoden V. xD 
All Genso Suikoden Series Soundtracks are great!

snippet.textDisplay: You should listen to Track 09 (Gothic neclord) from the "Genso Suikoden Music Collection Produced by Hiroyuki Namba" album and Track 04 (also named Gothic Neclord) from the "Genso Suikoden Music Collection Produced by Kentaro Hane" album if you liked this BGM. :3
snippet.textOriginal: You should listen to Track 09 (Gothic neclord) from the "Genso Suikoden Music Collection Produced by Hiroyuki Namba" album and Track 04 (also named Gothic Neclord) from the "Genso Suikoden Music Collection Produced by Kentaro Hane" album if you liked this BGM. :3
